markdown: EXHIBIT I BUSINESS ANALYSIS CONCLUSIONS National Performance * SALEM May YTD share (8.75) remains essentially flat versus 1980 (8.73) but reflects a softening trend due to: - Flatening trend on SALEM LIGHTS 85's and SALEM ULTRA. - Increased rate of decline on FULL FLAVOR 100's. * Cumulative volume is up 4.7% versus YAG principally due to the year-end 1980 load, but shipments evi- dence a softening trend. Geographic Performance * Share softness is not primarily a function of a particular geographic area. * SALEM's greatest share loss did occur in the South Atlantic, the area which represents our heartland and the largest share increase in Newport's expansion areas. * SALEM has above-average development in the South Atlantic, North Central, and Mid Continent which are good areas of menthol development. Demographic Performance * 18-24 year olds continue to represent SALEM's highest index of switching gains and usage followed by the 25-34 age segment, and thus, both groups represent the Brand's highest share of smokers. * In 1980, SALEM's ability to attract 18-24 year olds has softened due to an erosion in FULL FLAVOR's competitive appeal resulting in FULL FLAVOP. styles share of smoker loss among this segment. • SALEM LIGHTS, especially the 85's style, continues to demonstrate its competitive appeal to 18-24 year olds, the group primarily responsible for Newport's growth. 50244 1946

• SALEM LIGHTS, especially the 85's style, continues to demonstrate its competitive appeal to 18-24 year olds, the group primarily responsible for Newport's growth.
